results.title: Millions for the finding
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Eric Thompson and Hugh Alexander
results.brief_description: Survey of Australia’s mineral resources. Shows silver-lead-zinc mines at Broken Hill; copper-silver-lead-zinc mines at Mt Lyell in Tasmania; coal from the various mines of New South Wales; iron ore from South Australia and Yampi Sound to the blast furnaces at Newcastle, Port kembla and Whyalla; scheelite, from King Island in Bass Strait; oil from Exmouth Gulf, and radio-active minerals from Radium Hill. Modern methods of mineral detection are shown, including aerial surveying.

results.title: Millionaire for a pound
results.brief_description: A satirical impression without spoken commentary, of Surfers’ Paradise. Opening with colour shots of the idyllic countryside views approaching the town, the film quickly transfers to the gaudiness of the town itself with bizarre signs, neon lights and flashy flats. Features a tape-manipulated mouth organ and Beatniks! Rich with the iconography 60’s Australia, this is a fascinating document of the laconic, innocent charms that then characterised Australia’s favourite seaside idyll. Reminiscent of the surrealist social documentary work of Humphrey Jennings.

results.title: Millhouse: a white comedy
results.creator_credit: White Film Company and Emile de Antonio
results.brief_description: Newsreel and television footage is used to satirise the political career of Richard Millhouse Nixon. The film landed de Antonio on the director on Nixon’s infamous enemy list.

results.title: Mille Sept Cent Quatre Vingt Neuf = 1789
results.creator_credit: Georges Dancigers, Alexandre Mnouchkine and Arianne Mnouchkine
results.brief_description:
This film records a production of the historical play ‘1789’, in which the Theatre du Soleil re-enacts the French Revolution and its aftermath. It shows how the Revolution served only to replace one set of rulers (the aristocrats and nobles) with another (the rich), an analysis which is clearly influenced by Marxist thinking. Filmed in June 1973 during 13 shows presented on the stage of ‘La Cartoucherie de Vincennes’. Best print: X0131.

Credits: Producers, Georges Dancigers, Alexandre Mnouchkine ; director, Arianne Mnouchkine ; writer, Ariane Mnouchkine ; photography, Jean-Paul Meurisse, Michel Lebon, Eduardo Serra, Bernard Zitzerman.
Cast: Philippe Caubere, Mario Gonzales, Genevieve Penchenat, Jean-Claude Penchenat.

results.title: Milk: from farm to you. - 3rd ed.
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Thomas Smith and James Kennedy
results.brief_description: Follows the complete cycle of milk production, including the necessity of conception and calving. Explains homogenisation and pasteurisation, and depicts the production of related dairy products such as cheese and icecream. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Milk for the nation
results.creator_credit: W S Crawford Ltd, National Milk Productivity Council, Michael Curtis and Jonathan Ingrams
results.brief_description: The development of railways in Britain encouraged an interest in milk-marketing hygiene. The purity of British milk today is the result of painstaking research since that time. immense care is taken in every aspect of milk marketing. Veterinary inspectors ensure that the cattle are disease free, and laboratory assistants supervise every stage of its journey. They examine the milk during transport, and through the automatic pasteurisation, bottling and sealing processes. Narrated by Ronald Baddiley.
results.creator_credit_for_label: W S Crawford Ltd, National Milk Productivity Council, Michael Curtis and Jonathan Ingrams

results.title: Milk for South East Asia
results.brief_description: The most suitable dairy products for exporting to South-East Asia are anhydrous milk fat or butter oil and skimmed milk powder - neither require refrigeration. They are separated from milk in Australia and recombined with water and sugar in modern factories in Djakarta or other South-East Asian countries. 16,000 tons of milk fat and 50,000 tons of skimmed milk powder are exported each year to supplement the protein diet of people in these countries.

results.title: Milk at its best
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson Film Productions and Michael Robertson
results.brief_description: Shows how advances in technology have brought about a major change in the production and marketing of milk in the past few years. Notes the use of fully automated systems in dairies which ensure maximum efficiency and cleanliness, and how further tests are carried out in laboratories before packaging or bottling. All aspects of milk production are supervised by the Dairy Industry Marketing Authority which exercises strict control over hygiene. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Milk and milk foods
results.brief_description: Presents a visit to a dairy plant to show how milk is pasteurised, homogenised, how vitamin D is added and the ways in which milk is made into a wide variety of foods. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.creator_credit: Hugh Baddeley Productions and W. Hugh Baddeley
